messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] The Delete Key, was Digest Number 1554
messages.msgSnippet: Well Donna, the problem is some folks have not discovered the joys of the delete key.  And, please, if you are on digest, no rant/attack (been there done that)
messages.messageBody:
Well Donna, the problem is some folks have not discovered the joys of the
delete key. And, please, if you are on digest, no rant/attack (been there
done that) about you can't delete. You can scroll past.

However, I do think we should all try to cure one of my very bad habits (bad
Lynda <g>) and KISS the posts more frequently AND update the subject line.
See, I changed the subject line AND KISSed the post, even someone OAD can
learn new tricks <g>

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: <DACunefare@...>

> Start a new thread. Don't read what annoys you. Start talking about what
> you're interested in, get other folks interested with you.
>
> This is the essence of unschooling, for adults and kids too. Don't tell
> people they shouldn't be interested in something because you aren't, don't
> expect them to do and say exactly what you are interested in doing and
> saying. If you want to learn about something, do it. If you want to show
> people something wonderful, do it. If you want to stop listening and go
read
> a book, do it. Don't drag your kids off from what they're interested in to
do
> what you think is important, and don't shush adults either.
>
> It IS a free country. The framers of our constitution established free
speech
> as a right PRECISELY for situations like this, so that no one need ever
fear
> criticizing their government, it's actions, or it's policies. If it truly
is
> the greatest nation on earth that is a huge reason why.
>
> I'm interested in hearing everything folks have to say on all sides of
this,
> except I'd like to ask the shushers to please, go ahead and talk about
> something else but allow the rest of these folks to talk in peace here
> without trying to shut them up. Their opinions can't hurt you or our
country.
> Thanks.
>
> Deborah
